description: Erection of single storey rear extension (6.00m in depth, maximum height of 3.15m and eaves height of 2.94m)
decision_conditions: The proposed extensions and alterations are considered to fall within the parameters of  permitted development as set out under Schedule 2, Part 1, Class A of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

A certificate for lawfulness for existing use has been submitted Section 191 of the Town and Country Planning Act directs that(1)If any person wishes to ascertain whetherâ€”(a)any existing use of buildings or other land is lawful;(b)any operations which have been carried out in, on, over or under land are lawful; or(c)any other matter constituting a failure to comply with any condition or limitation subject to which planning permission has been granted is lawful,he may make an application for the purpose to the local planning authority specifying the land and describing the use, operations or other matter.It is not clear if the applicant is seeking retrospective approval for the existing extension or applying for approval for a new proposed extension.The applicant is advised that a Certificate of Lawfulness under section 192 of the 1990 Act should be submitted if they wish to obatin confirmation of the lawfulness of a proposed development.

On the 1st May 2024 the Council adopted a new Validation Local List. As per the new validation requirements, please complete and submit a Validation Checklist - Section 3. The new Validation  Local List and checklists can be obtained via the council's website: https://www.kingston.gov.uk/downloads/download/261/validation-requirements-for-planning-applicationsThe LPA will not conduct any validation checks until the correct Checklist has been submitted. Upon receipt of a completed Checklist, the application will be assigned to a validation officer to review. Please do not simply state N/A in the checklist without a written justification.If you need to make any changes to your application please try to do this via the Planning Portal website where possible. If that is not possible please send amended documents via the email address quoted in this letter.
